meanings.definition: A sound made by the mouth, as in "chat"
meanings.sent1: The baby made a cute 'ch' sound while playing.
meanings.sent2: I heard a 'ch' coming from the kitchen as my mom prepared dinner.
meanings.sent3: The 'ch' sound of the door closing made the dog bark.
meanings.sent4: The 'ch' of the wind through the trees was soothing.
meanings.sent5: The 'ch' sound of the clock ticking filled the room.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement equal to 100 in the metric system
meanings.sent1: She needed to buy a 'ch' of fabric for her project.
meanings.sent2: The race was measured in 'ch' to determine the winner.
meanings.sent3: He carried a 'ch' of books on his back to the library.
meanings.sent4: The 'ch' of water in the pool was refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The farmer planted a 'ch' of seeds in the field.

meanings.sent1: In Scotland, they say 'ch' instead of 'I'.
meanings.sent2: She always refers to herself as 'ch' when speaking in Scottish.
meanings.sent3: The Scottish man proudly declared, 'Ch am the best!'
meanings.sent4: When in Scotland, remember to say 'ch' instead of 'I'.
meanings.sent5: The Scottish child proudly exclaimed, 'Ch want to play!'.
